thread.section_title: Business News, Economy, Finance & ASX Market News
thread.title: Wynyard Place granted development approval

title: Wynyard Place granted development approval
text:
Brookfield Property Partners has been given State Significant Development (SSD) approval for the proposed $1 billion Wynyard Place. Photo: Make
Wynyard railway station, one of the busiest in the city, is set to get a major facelift as part of the $1 billion Wynyard Place project which has been given the green light.
It will add more cranes to Sydney's already congested 130 crane-laden skyline and will be carried out amid the pedestrianisation of George Street.
Sydney is in the grip of a building boom with more than $10 billion of new projects across the city from the planned $1 billion upgrade of Circular Quay, including the new $200 million ferry terminals, sweeping out to the $6 billion Barangarooâ€‹ South precinct and the $1 billion-plus International Convention Centre.
The suburbs are also alive to the sound of jack hammers.
Advertisement Development of Wynyard Place will entail the consolidation of four buildings immediately adjacent to Wynyard Station into one unified centre, including a 27-floor office tower, four levels of retail space and basement parking.
With its modern glass facade and natural light, companies such as Google are said to be interested as potential anchor tenants.
Owners Brookfield Property Partners said in addition to a new modern state-of-the-art office tower at 10 Carrington Street, the project will include the restoration of the historic Shell House and Wynyard Lane.
Under the scheme the George Street entrance to Wynyard will be transformed into a grand transit hall and public concourse with new retail and food offerings.
At the York Street end of Wynyard will be the new Barangaroo Walk to connect to the 60,000-plus new workers at the western end of the city.
The project, which yesterday received State Significant Development (SSD) approval, will start as soon as it gains the final nod from the NSW Government, with completion scheduled for mid-2019.
Brookfield Property Partners' Australian president and chief operating officer, Kurt Wilkinson, said Wynyard Place will provide "exceptional amenities and an exciting environment that will draw people together to work, shop, meet and relax".
Wynyard Place has been designed by international architectural firm Make in collaboration with Sydney-based Architectus.
Mr Wilkinson said the office tower will maximise natural light access and provides large floor space to accommodate the new style of hot desking demanded in a modern business.
But before the gain will come the pain, with high-vis vests and dust masks being the necessary attire for workers along George Street for the coming few years.
